pros: Challenging - Rewarding - Beautiful campus.  I was very intrigued by the psychiatric field and decided to give it a try.  I am enjoying my job tremendously and am learning a lot.  It is really an area of health care you can feel as though you make a difference.  My supervisor and co-workers were very helpful.
cons:
At times, the patients can be difficult; however if you want to be in this field, you have to expect some difficulties.  They are not bad people; they just have an illness that affects their behaviors.  Sometimes they are angry; but it goes away very soon.  Due to the care and concern of the staff, they are well taken care of.
At times, there are some staff who have bad attitudes and they don't stay long here.  I guess that explains the negative comments on this page about Northlake.  They just must not have given it a chance.  Obviously it wasn't the right field for them to be in.

pros: Was close to home, nice nurses
cons: Lots pay, long hours, short staffed. All about the money and not the patients!

pros: You work alongside mental health providers and professionals that really do care about the patients.
cons: Some of the management is overall incompetent and do not possess the education, experience, or skills.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Mandeville, LA
pros:
Nothing good . Drama day and night   Code green 
from all units at same time.
cons: Horrific,  no team work. You'll be doing for the team that sits ,jokes,laughs and allows the patients go to each other's rooms to have Intercourse.  You do the work for 2 to 3 staffs.  No time to eat you will feel like fainting  at times and still no one cares. Rooms are filthy patients don't bathe not encouraged  to bathe.  Floors have feces . Patients defecate in the showers.  HIV and hepatitis risk besides other diseases. . If you voice your concern they will not like you.  Don't come here for treatment the only one given is mistreatment, bullied, teased, over drugged. Adolescent  is horrible . Don't bring your loved one there.

pros: Really can’t remember any that are worth mentioning. Even lunch is too expensive
cons: Staff and patient safety. Ness Corp has no idea how to run a hospital. In competent Supervisors and Managers. Nurses who never leave the nurses station because they are “afraid” and medication nurses who do not follow procedure for identifying patients or document properly. List goes on and on.

pros: You can punch in and disappear for hours and get paid for it.
cons: Horrible parent company, bad pay, bad benefits. HR Dept. spreads gossip, nurses don't care, and the ownership is totally incompetent.    The place is very unsafe.  Lots of employee injuries.

pros: There are no pros to list.
cons: The drama is HIGH, employees are WAY under paid, and benefits are not so good.
